page.title: 01GITTISHAM AND COMBE
page.content: The twelve square kilometers of the Domesday block contain most of the Parish of Gittisham and the ancient manor of Combe. The area is bounded to the West South and East by the high ground of Gittisham common and East Hill, and to the South by the Otter Valley, which also carries the main A30 trunk road and the railway line between London and Exeter. The village is small and has not suffered major development; it retains much of the atmosphere of a traditional Devon village, nestling between the hills which cut it off from Honiton and the busy main roads. The estate of Combe is still in private hands and owns most of the land of the block. The manor house is mainly mediaeval on an ancient site. It is now let as a Hotel.
